body.p:
Mayfield Ky
Hon Thos E Bramlette
Gov of Kentucky

We would respectfully represent to your excellency that at the May term of the Graves Circuit Court Judgment was rendered against N C Pitman committing for a breach of the peace for $25 and at the present Nov term another another judgment was rendered against him for $5 for breach of the peace committed in 1863 during the great excitement of the War. Mr Pittman belonged to Gregory's state Guard and was a bold fearless advocate of the Union cause which we believe to be the cause of his being indicted scarcely a union man in this disloyal part of Kentucky has escaped a persecution from a rebel as the Law is in the hands of Rebels who use it as a Machine to oppress union men our only hope is to look to your Excellency for pardon and as Mr Pitman is a poor man we would earnestly ask that you interpose in his behalf and relieve him as far as you can

J T Bolinger
